DOC.brief_summary: The overall objective study determine effect high tea consumption biological marker oxidative stress mediate lung cancer risk .
DOC.brief_title: High Tea Consumption Smoking Related Oxidative Stress
DOC.criteria: FEV1 < 85 % least 25 packyears current former smoking history . No diagnosis internal cancer within last 5 year chemotherapy radiation internal cancer within last 5 year . Meets Southwest Oncology Group ( SWOG ) performance status criterion 01 . Not pregnant intend get pregnant study period ( woman participant ) . Willing drink 4 cup tea ( cup brew 2 tea bag 12 ounce water ) 1month runin period 6month intervention period . Willing refrain consume tea tea product start one month placebo runin period entire study period ( total 8 month ) Willing refrain consume one caffeinated product ( coffee , soda.. ) start one month placebo runin period entire study period ( total 8 month ) . Subjects take megadoses vitamin trial . This define 400 IU vitamin E , 200 ug selenium , 1 gm vitamin C per day , tolerable upper limit supplement define Dietary Reference Intake panel develop Food Nutrition Board Institute Medicine . Such vitamin therapy must discontinue least 2 week prior study entry . Subjects immunosuppressed virtue medication disease . Serious concurrent illness could interfere study regimen . Subjects history invasive cancer within past 5 year . Subjects drink 5 cup nonherbal tea per week . Subjects unwilling consume caffeinated beverage . Subjects unable perform force expiratory maneuver spirometry test . More one acute emphysema exacerbation within last 6 month period . Subjects oxygen . Women positive urinary pregnancy test .
